Alovera.description: A hardy, low-maintenance plant known for air-purifying and skin-soothing benefits. Perfect for beginners and indoor spaces.
Alovera.light: Bright, indirect sunlight. Can tolerate direct sun.
Alovera.watering: Let soil dry completely between waterings.

Lucky Bamboo.description: A popular indoor plant symbolizing luck, wealth, and positive energy.
Lucky Bamboo.watering: Keep roots covered with water or keep soil moist.
Lucky Bamboo.soil: Well-draining potting mix if grown in soil.

Snake.description: An extremely resilient plant that thrives on neglect. Great for air purification.
Snake.watering: Water every 2–3 weeks, letting soil dry between waterings.

Lemon Grass.description: An aromatic grass often used in cooking and teas, also a natural mosquito repellent.
Lemon Grass.watering: Water regularly; keep soil evenly moist.

Money Plant.description: A common indoor climber believed to bring prosperity and positive energy.

Dracaena Marginata.description: Also called Dragon Tree, it’s a striking plant with long, slender leaves.
Dracaena Marginata.watering: Allow the top inch of soil to dry between waterings.

Pachira Aquatica.description: Known as the Money Tree, often braided and believed to bring good fortune.
Pachira Aquatica.watering: Water when top 2–3 inches of soil are dry.

Schefflera.description: Also called Umbrella Plant, has glossy green leaves that fan out.
Schefflera.watering: Water weekly, allow soil to dry slightly.

Zamia plant.description: A low-maintenance indoor plant with thick, waxy leaves; drought tolerant.
Zamia plant.watering: Water every 2–3 weeks; allow soil to dry completely.

Alocasia plant.description: Striking tropical plant with large, heart-shaped leaves.
Alocasia plant.watering: Keep soil consistently moist but not soggy.

Watermelon Peperomia.description: Compact houseplant with round, watermelon-patterned leaves.
